channel.description: Chapter 8 - Ansible Cookbooks Until now, most of this book has demonstrated individual aspects of Ansible—inventory, playbooks, ad-hoc tasks, etc. But this chapter synthesizes everything we’ve gone over in the previous chapters and shows how Ansible is applied to real-world infrastructure management scenarios. Highly-Available Infrastructure with Ansible Real-world web applications require redundancy and horizontal scalability with multi-server infrastructure. In the following example, we’ll use Ansible to configure a complex infrastructure on servers provisioned either locally (via Vagrant and VirtualBox) or on a set of automatically-provisioned instances (running on either DigitalOcean or Amazon Web Services):
